titles: Here is some comfort for poor cavaleeres: or, The Duke of Yorks speech to the Parliament of England, concerning his fathers old souldiers; also, a relation of the forty five sail of ships that have crost the ocean ... Prince Robert doth represent the king's royal person in Portugal. They'l fetch a queen with store of Indian treasure ... To a pleasant tune called Moncks March, or, Maids will say nay and take it.
notes: Right half-sheet contains: The second part to the same tune.
Date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
keywords: James --  II, --  King of England, 1633-1701 --  Poetry.
Catherine, --  of Braganza, Queen, consort of Charles II, King of England, 1638-1705 --  Poetry.
